task.name: imstat
task.shortdescription: Calculates statistical information from an image or image region

param.name: imagename
param.shortdescription: Name of the input image
param.description: Name of the input image

param.name: axes
param.shortdescription: List of axes to evaluate statistics over. Default is all axes.
param.description: List of axes to evaluate statistics over. Default is all axes.

param.name: region
param.shortdescription: Region selection. Default is to use the full image.
param.description: Region selection. Default is to use the full image.

param.name: box
param.shortdescription: Rectangular region(s) to select in direction plane. Default is to use the entire direction plane.
param.description: Rectangular region(s) to select in direction plane. Default is to use the entire direction plane.

param.name: chans
param.shortdescription: Channels to use. Default is to use all channels.
param.description: Channels to use. Default is to use all channels.

param.name: stokes
param.shortdescription: Stokes planes to use. Default is to use all Stokes planes.
param.description: Stokes planes to use. Default is to use all Stokes planes.

param.name: listit
param.shortdescription: Print stats and bounding box to logger?
param.description: Print stats and bounding box to logger?

param.name: verbose
param.shortdescription: Print additional messages to logger?
param.description: Print additional messages to logger?

param.name: mask
param.shortdescription: Mask to use. Default is none.
param.description: Mask to use. Default is none.

param.name: stretch
param.shortdescription: Stretch the mask if necessary and possible?
param.description: Stretch the mask if necessary and possible?

param.name: logfile
param.shortdescription: Name of file to write fit results.
param.description: Name of file to write fit results.

param.name: append
param.shortdescription: If logfile exists, append to it if True or overwrite it if False
param.description: If logfile exists, append to it if True or overwrite it if False

param.name: algorithm
param.shortdescription: Algorithm to use. Supported values are "biweight", "chauvenet", "classic", "fit-half", and "hinges-fences". Minimum match is supported.
param.description: Algorithm to use. Supported values are "biweight", "chauvenet", "classic", "fit-half", and "hinges-fences". Minimum match is supported.

param.name: fence
param.shortdescription: Fence value for hinges-fences. A negative value means use the entire data set (ie default to the "classic" algorithm). Ignored if algorithm is not "hinges-fences".
param.description: Fence value for hinges-fences. A negative value means use the entire data set (ie default to the "classic" algorithm). Ignored if algorithm is not "hinges-fences".

param.name: center
param.shortdescription: Center to use for fit-half. Valid choices are "mean", "median", and "zero". Ignored if algorithm is not "fit-half".
param.description: Center to use for fit-half. Valid choices are "mean", "median", and "zero". Ignored if algorithm is not "fit-half".

param.name: lside
param.shortdescription: For fit-half, use values <= center for real data if True? If False, use values >= center as real data. Ignored if algorithm is not "fit-half".
param.description: For fit-half, use values <= center for real data if True? If False, use values >= center as real data. Ignored if algorithm is not "fit-half".

param.name: zscore
param.shortdescription: For chauvenet, this is the target maximum number of standard deviations data may have to be included. If negative, use Chauvenet"s criterion. Ignored if algorithm is not "chauvenet".
param.description: For chauvenet, this is the target maximum number of standard deviations data may have to be included. If negative, use Chauvenet"s criterion. Ignored if algorithm is not "chauvenet".

param.name: maxiter
param.shortdescription: For chauvenet, this is the maximum number of iterations to attempt. Iterating will stop when either this limit is reached, or the zscore criterion is met. If negative, iterate until the zscore criterion is met. Ignored if algorithm is not "chauvenet".
param.description: For chauvenet, this is the maximum number of iterations to attempt. Iterating will stop when either this limit is reached, or the zscore criterion is met. If negative, iterate until the zscore criterion is met. Ignored if algorithm is not "chauvenet".

param.name: clmethod
param.shortdescription: Method to use for calculating classical statistics. Supported methods are "auto", "tiled", and "framework". Ignored if algorithm is not "classic".
param.description: Method to use for calculating classical statistics. Supported methods are "auto", "tiled", and "framework". Ignored if algorithm is not "classic".

param.name: niter
param.shortdescription: For biweight, this is the maximum number of iterations to attempt. Iterating will stop when either this limit is reached, or the zscore criterion is met. If negative, do a fast, simple computation (see description). Ignored if the algorithm is not "biweight".
param.description: For biweight, this is the maximum number of iterations to attempt. Iterating will stop when either this limit is reached, or the zscore criterion is met. If negative, do a fast, simple computation (see description). Ignored if the algorithm is not "biweight".
